a person having the right of farming, tilling of the land etc.
(the tip of a creeper) to advance; to progress; to grow further.
= ಕುಡಿನಿಮಿರ್.
= ಕುಡಿನೀರು.
water that is fit to drink; potable water.
the part of a plough that cuts the soil; a plough-share.
either of the two ends of a rope.
a glance from the outward corner of the eye; a side-glance.
any person from whom one is descended; the forefather; an ancestor.
= ಕುಡಿತ.
the burning point of a wick.
a plantain leaf with its tip intact.
the soft shoot of the bamboo.
a man engaged in farming; an agriculturist; a farmer.
to turn or bend backward the tip (of something); (fig.) to take a girl from the same family, in a marriage (as to take a daughter's daughter as the wife of one's son's son).
a lighting that looks like the a creeper with divided branches.
either of the pointed extremities of a moustache.
the moustaches of a boy in his teen-age.
either of a pair of movable, jointed sense organs on the head of most arthropods, as insects, crabs or lobsters; feeler; the antenna.
